org.hps.record.triggerbank

Class TriggerModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hps.record.triggerbank.TriggerModule

  • public final class TriggerModule
extends Object
    Class TriggerModule handles trigger cuts. By default, it sets all cuts such that any cluster or cluster pair will pass. Cuts can be set after initialization via the setCutValue method using a cut identifier. All valid cut identifiers are static class variables for easy reference.

    All cut value calculations are static methods, and can thusly be called without initializing an instance of the module.

    Both Cluster objects and SSPCluster objects are supported, except for the seed energy cut, as this value is not present in SSPCluster objects.

    This module supports the following cuts:
    • Seed Energy Lower Bound
    • Seed Energy Lower Bound
    • Seed Energy Upper Bound
    • Cluster Total Energy Upper Bound
    • Cluster Total Energy Lower Bound
    • Cluster Hit Count Lower Bound
    • Pair Energy Sum Upper Bound
    • Pair Energy Sum Lower Bound
    • Pair Energy Difference Upper Bound
    • Pair Energy Slope Lower Bound
    • Pair Coplanarity Upper Bound
    • Pair Time Coincidence Upper Bound
    See Also:
    Cluster, SSPCluster

      boolean pairEnergySlopeCut(Cluster[] clusterPair)
      Requires that the distance from the beam of the lowest energy cluster in a cluster pair satisfies the following:
      E_low + R_min * F >= PAIR_ENERGY_SLOPE_LOW
      boolean pairEnergySlopeCut(Cluster[] clusterPair, Point p0, Point p1)
      Requires that the distance from the beam of the lowest energy cluster in a cluster pair satisfies the following:

      E_low + R_min * F >= PAIR_ENERGY_SLOPE_LOW

      This method is for use with clusters that do not have a linked ID decoder, thus disallowing the acquisition of their indices from their cell ID.

      Checks that the energy slope value is above threshold.

    • Field Detail

      • ORIGIN_X

        private static final double ORIGIN_X
        The calorimeter mid-plane, defined by the photon beam position (30.52 mrad) at the calorimeter face (z = 1393 mm).

      • PAIR_ENERGY_SLOPE_F

        public static final String PAIR_ENERGY_SLOPE_F
        The value of the parameter "F" in the energy slope equation E_low GeV + R_min mm * F GeV/mm. Units are in GeV / mm.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PAIR_ENERGY_SUM_LOW

        public static final String PAIR_ENERGY_SUM_LOW
        The lower bound for the pair energy sum cut. The sum of the energies of two clusters must exceed this value to pass the cut. Units are in GeV.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PAIR_ENERGY_SUM_HIGH

        public static final String PAIR_ENERGY_SUM_HIGH
        The upper bound for the pair energy sum cut. The sum of the energies of two clusters must be below this value to pass the cut. Units are in GeV.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLUSTER_HIT_COUNT_LOW

        public static final String CLUSTER_HIT_COUNT_LOW
        The threshold for the cluster hit count cut. Clusters must have this many hits or more to pass the cut.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PAIR_ENERGY_SLOPE_LOW

        public static final String PAIR_ENERGY_SLOPE_LOW
        The threshold for the energy slope cut. The value of the energy slope equation must exceed this value to pass the cut. Units are in GeV.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PAIR_COPLANARITY_HIGH

        public static final String PAIR_COPLANARITY_HIGH
        The bound for the coplanarity cut. The coplanarity angle for the cluster pair must be below this value to pass the cut. Units are in degrees.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLUSTER_SEED_ENERGY_LOW

        public static final String CLUSTER_SEED_ENERGY_LOW
        The lower bound for the cluster seed energy cut. The seed energy of a cluster must exceed this value to pass the cut. Units are in GeV.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLUSTER_SEED_ENERGY_HIGH

        public static final String CLUSTER_SEED_ENERGY_HIGH
        The upper bound for the cluster seed energy cut. The seed energy of a cluster must be below this value to pass the cut. Units are in GeV.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLUSTER_TOTAL_ENERGY_LOW

        public static final String CLUSTER_TOTAL_ENERGY_LOW
        The lower bound for the cluster total energy cut. The energy of a cluster must exceed this value to pass the cut.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLUSTER_TOTAL_ENERGY_HIGH

        public static final String CLUSTER_TOTAL_ENERGY_HIGH
        The upper bound for the cluster total energy cut. The energy of a cluster must be below this value to pass the cut. Units are in GeV.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PAIR_ENERGY_DIFFERENCE_HIGH

        public static final String PAIR_ENERGY_DIFFERENCE_HIGH
        The bound for the pair energy difference cut. The absolute value of the difference between the energies of the cluster pair must be below this value to pass the cut. Units are in GeV.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PAIR_TIME_COINCIDENCE

        public static final String PAIR_TIME_COINCIDENCE
        The maximum amount of time by which two clusters are allowed to be separated. Units are in ns.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • cuts

        private final Map<String,Double> cuts
        Stores each of the cut values used by the module. Map keys are defined as publicly-accessible static variables in the class.

      • position

        private static final double[][][] position
        An array of the form position[iy][ix] that contains the hardware SSP position mappings for each crystal. Note that ix in the array goes from -22 (representing ix = 23) up to 25 (representing ix = 23) and uses array index x = 0 as a valid parameter, while ix skips zero.

        Note that in this table, position[][] = { x, z, y } by in the coordinate system employed by the rest of the class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TriggerModule

        public TriggerModule()
        Creates a default TriggerModule. The cuts are defined such that all physical clusters (i.e. with energy above zero) will be accepted.

      • TriggerModule

        public TriggerModule(double... cutValues)
        Creates a TriggerModule with trigger cuts defined by the argument array. The order of the cut value arguments are as follows:
        • Cluster Hit Count Lower Bound (Hits)
        • Cluster Seed Energy Lower Bound (GeV)
        • Cluster Seed Energy Upper Bound (GeV)
        • Cluster Seed Total Lower Bound (GeV)
        • Cluster Seed Total Upper Bound (GeV)
        • Pair Energy Sum Lower Bound (GeV)
        • Pair Energy Sum Upper Bound (GeV)
        • Pair Energy Difference Upper Bound (GeV)
        • Pair Energy Slope Lower Bound (GeV)
        • Pair Coplanarity Upper Bound (Degrees)
        • Pair Energy Slope Parameter F (GeV / mm)

    • Method Detail

      • getCutValue

        public double getCutValue(String cut)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the value of the requested cut, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        cut - - The identifier of the cut. This can be obtained through the publicly-accessible static identifiers in this class.
        Returns:
        Returns the cut value as a double.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the cut identifier specified in the argument is not valid.

      • loadDAQConfiguration

        public void loadDAQConfiguration(SinglesTriggerConfig config)
        Loads triggers settings from the DAQ configuration for a singles trigger. Singles trigger cuts will be set to match those defined in the configuration object, while pair trigger cuts will be set to accept all possible clusters.
        Parameters:
        config - - The DAQ configuration settings.

      • loadDAQConfiguration

        public void loadDAQConfiguration(PairTriggerConfig config)
        Loads triggers settings from the DAQ configuration for a pair trigger. All trigger settings will be loaded directly from the DAQ configuration and set appropriately.
        Parameters:
        config - - The DAQ configuration settings.

      • setCutValue

        public void setCutValue(String cut,
                        double value)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the value of the cut specified by the identifier given in the argument to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        cut - - The identifier of the cut to which the new value should be assigned. These can be obtained as publicly-accessible static variables from this class.
        value - - The new cut value.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the argument cut identifier is not valid.

      • setCutValues

        public void setCutValues(boolean isSingles,
                         String cutValues)
        Sets the cluster singles cuts to the values parsed from an argument string.
        Parameters:
        isSingles - - Indicates whether the parser should expect 10 cut values (for pairs) or 3 (for singles).
        cutValues - - A string representing the cuts values. This must be formatted in the style of "Emin Emax Nmin ...".

      • clusterHitCountCut

        public boolean clusterHitCountCut(Cluster cluster)
        Checks whether a cluster passes the cluster hit count cut. This is defined as N_hits >= CLUSTER_HIT_COUNT_LOW.
        Parameters:
        cluster - - The cluster to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster passes the cut and false if the cluster does not.

      • clusterHitCountCut

        Parameters:
        cluster - - The cluster to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster passes the cut and false if the cluster does not.

      • clusterSeedEnergyCut

        public boolean clusterSeedEnergyCut(Cluster cluster)
        Checks whether a cluster passes the seed energy cut. This is defined as CLUSTER_SEED_ENERGY_LOW <= E_seed <= CLUSTER_SEED_ENERGY_HIGH.
        Parameters:
        cluster - - The cluster to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster passes the cut and false if the cluster does not.

      • clusterSeedEnergyCutHigh

        Parameters:
        cluster - - The cluster to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster passes the cut and false if the cluster does not.

        Returns:

      • getTopBottomPairs

        public static <E> List<E[]> getTopBottomPairs(List<E> clusters,
                                              Class<E> clusterType)
                                       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Forms all possible pairs of top/bottom clusters from a given list of clusters.
        Parameters:
        clusters - - The clusters from which to form the pairs.
        Returns:
        Returns a List collection of size two Cluster arrays representing top/bottom pairs. The first entry in the array is always the top cluster, with the bottom cluster in the next position.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • getTopBottomPairs

        public static List<Cluster[]> getTopBottomPairs(Cluster... clusters)
        Forms all possible pairs of top/bottom clusters from a given list of clusters.
        Parameters:
        clusters - - The clusters from which to form the pairs.
        Returns:
        Returns a List collection of size two Cluster arrays representing top/bottom pairs. The first entry in the array is always the top cluster, with the bottom cluster in the next position.

        clusters - - The clusters from which to form the pairs.

      • pairCoplanarityCut

        public boolean pairCoplanarityCut(Cluster[] clusterPair)

        Parameters:
        clusterPair - - The cluster pair to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster pair passes the cut and false if it does not.

                                  Point p0,
                                  Point p1)

        public boolean pairEnergyDifferenceCut(Cluster[] clusterPair)

        Parameters:
        clusterPair - - The cluster pair to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster pair passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • pairEnergyDifferenceCut

        Parameters:
        clusterPair - - The cluster pair to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster pair passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • pairEnergySlopeCut

        public boolean pairEnergySlopeCut(Cluster[] clusterPair)
        Requires that the distance from the beam of the lowest energy cluster in a cluster pair satisfies the following:
        E_low + R_min * F >= PAIR_ENERGY_SLOPE_LOW
        Parameters:
        clusterPair - - The cluster pair to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster pair passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • pairEnergySlopeCut

        public boolean pairEnergySlopeCut(Cluster[] clusterPair,
                                  Point p0,
                                  Point p1)
        Requires that the distance from the beam of the lowest energy cluster in a cluster pair satisfies the following:

        E_low + R_min * F >= PAIR_ENERGY_SLOPE_LOW

        This method is for use with clusters that do not have a linked ID decoder, thus disallowing the acquisition of their indices from their cell ID.
        Parameters:
        clusterPair - - The cluster pair to check.
        p0 - - A Point containing the x and y indices of the first cluster in the pair.
        p1 - - A Point containing the x and y indices of the second cluster in the pair.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster pair passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • pairEnergySumCut

        public boolean pairEnergySumCut(Cluster[] clusterPair)
        Checks if the sum of the energies of the clusters making up a cluster pair is within an energy sum threshold. This is defined as PAIR_ENERGY_SUM_LOW <= E_1 + E_2 <= PAIR_ENERGY_SUM_HIGH.
        Parameters:
        clusterPair - - The cluster pair to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster pair passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • pairEnergySumCutHigh

        public boolean pairEnergySumCutHigh(Cluster[] clusterPair)
        Checks if the sum of the energies of the clusters making up a cluster pair is below the energy sum upper bound threshold. This is defined as E_1 + E_2 <= PAIR_ENERGY_SUM_HIGH.
        Parameters:
        clusterPair - - The cluster pair to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster pair passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • pairEnergySumCutLow

        public boolean pairEnergySumCutLow(Cluster[] clusterPair)
        Checks if the sum of the energies of the clusters making up a cluster pair is above the energy sum lower bound threshold. This is defined as PAIR_ENERGY_SUM_LOW <= E_1 + E_2.
        Parameters:
        clusterPair - - The cluster pair to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster pair passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • pairEnergySumCut

        Parameters:
        clusterPair - - The cluster pair to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster pair passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • getCrystalPosition

        private static double[] getCrystalPosition(int ix,
                                           int iy)
                                    throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Gets the mapped position used by the SSP for a specific crystal. Warning: This is the hardware position mapping, and does not always align perfectly with the LCSim coordinate system. For instance, the electron side of the detector is has positive x coordinates in the hardware system, and is negative in LCSim.
        Parameters:
        ix - - The crystal x-index.
        iy - - The crystal y-index.
        Returns:
        Returns the crystal position as a double array of form { x, y, z }.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Occurs if in either of the cases where ix == 0 or |ix| > 23 for the x-index and either of the cases where iy == 0 or |iy| > 5 for the y-index.

      • getValueCoplanarity

        private static double getValueCoplanarity(double[] x,
                                          double[] y)
        Calculates the value used by the coplanarity cut.
        Parameters:
        x - - A two-dimensional array consisting of the first and second clusters' x-positions.
        y - - A two-dimensional array consisting of the first and second clusters' y-positions.
        Returns:
        Returns the cluster pair's coplanarity.

      • getValueTimeCoincidence

        private static double getValueTimeCoincidence(double[] time)
        Calculates the value used by the time coincidence cut.
        Parameters:
        time - - A two-dimensional array consisting of the first and second clusters' times.
        Returns:
        Returns the absolute difference between the times of the two clusters.

      • inFiducialRegion

        private static final boolean inFiducialRegion(int ix,
                                              int iy)
        Indicates whether the argument cluster is located in the fiducial region or not.
        Parameters:
        cluster - - The cluster to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the cluster is located in the fiducial region and false otherwise.

      • pairCoplanarityCut

        private boolean pairCoplanarityCut(double coplanarityAngle)
        Checks if a coplanarity angle is within threshold.
        Parameters:
        coplanarityAngle - - The cluster coplanarity angle.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the angle passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • pairEnergyDifferenceCut

        private boolean pairEnergyDifferenceCut(double energyDifference)
        Checks if the energy difference between the clusters making up a cluster pair is below an energy difference threshold.
        Parameters:
        energyDifference - - The absolute value of the difference of the energies of the cluster pair.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the energy difference passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • pairEnergySlopeCut

        private boolean pairEnergySlopeCut(double energySlope)
        Checks that the energy slope value is above threshold.
        Parameters:
        energySlope - - The energy slope value.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the energy slope passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • pairEnergySumCut

        private boolean pairEnergySumCut(double energySum)
        Checks if the sum of the energies of clusters making up a cluster pair is within an energy sum threshold.
        Parameters:
        energySum - - The sum of the cluster energies.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the energy sum passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • pairEnergySumCutHigh

        private boolean pairEnergySumCutHigh(double energySum)
        Checks if the sum of the energies of clusters making up a cluster pair is below the pair energy sum upper bound cut.
        Parameters:
        energySum - - The sum of the cluster energies.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the energy sum passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • pairEnergySumCutLow

        private boolean pairEnergySumCutLow(double energySum)
        Checks if the sum of the energies of clusters making up a cluster pair is above the pair energy sum lower bound cut.
        Parameters:
        energySum - - The sum of the cluster energies.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the energy sum passes the cut and false if it does not.

      • pairTimeCoincidenceCut

        private boolean pairTimeCoincidenceCut(double timeDifference)
        Checks if the absolute difference between the times between two clusters is below the time coincidence cut.
        Parameters:
        timeDifference - - The absolute difference in time between the clusters.
        Returns:
        true if the energy sum passes the cut and false if it does not.
